info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 21 at 5:29AM PST until November 21 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Los Angeles.
* WHEN...Until 700 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Rockslides and mudslides are possible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 526 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated areas of heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor urban and small creek flooding in the advisory area. - Extended till 7AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Acton, Mount Wilson, Pasadena, Burbank, Griffith Park, Universal City, North Hollywood, Van Nuys, West Covina, Glendora, Encino, Santa Clarita, Northridge, San Dimas, Pomona, Chatsworth, Woodland Hills, Altadena, La Canada Flintridge and Glendale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST THIS MORNING
